intro: Geissanthus furfuraceus, commonly known as the hairy geissanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in high-altitude environments. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related genera. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
